website_summaries.verdict: Great for teachers and presenters, this affordable document camera is acceptable for many uses. It does not, however, work well with small type.
pros: Connects to projector, monitor, TV, or other output via HDMI
Convenient swivel head and stand with multiple joints
cons: Does not deliver good results with newspaper articles, historical documents, and other small-print sources

customer_reviews.title: Not enough resolution as a document copier
customer_reviews.text: Works OK as a Web Camera. It is also be helpful in a teaching situation where display of instructors drawing and presentation would be effective for a large number of people to view. However, I wanted to use it as document copier. Not! I tried to copy articles from old newspapers, for historical purposes, and failed. The small type was hard to see, and impossible to OCR.. If the camera were at least 12 MP, or better yet 16 MP, it could really be called a document copier.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Brownlee

customer_reviews.title: Works for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I needed a document camera to run an ACT class. I am a private tutor and don't have access to the big bucks or big discounts that the school districts have. I purchased this and am pleased with it. I can make adjustments to the height so that I can get it as close as I need. This is separate from the jumps in and out that I can make on the camera itself. It is sturdy and doesn't fall over. This is just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: A Truly Awesome Training for Modern Instruction
customer_reviews.text: Wow! If you are a teacher, instructor, or trainer, this is a phenomenal teaching/learning. aid. Using legal paper size white boards, you can project your Lap Top presentations and your Mini white board real time presentations onto a movie screen or smart board by switching your projector between your lap top and Ipevo VZ-R. The white boards allow you to erase or save the finished board notes for later review. If you provide training classes with electronic circuits and other instrumentation, you can also provide real time demonstrations as well. The efficiency obtained with this equipment is truly fantastic. The availability of all the controls directly on the Ipevo makes this even more useful during any form of dynamic presentation.
customer_reviews.author: Terrance R. Banach

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to make videos of problem solutions for my classes. When on a Windows machine I use Snagit to capture the video. I have also used it on my Linux machine (Kubuntu) and it worked without any problem. The built-in light helps eliminate shadows. I use an 8.5 X 11 inch legal pad to work the problems and the document camera captures the video.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Berg

customer_reviews.title: Slightly unreliable.
customer_reviews.text: I like the image quality and the simple features of the camera. Unfortunately, it freezes or restarts several times a day and has since month one of use. I've tried different power cords and power sources. It's the camera. Just inconvenient and makes me wonder if it's going to break soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob O.

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Using this for the first time this semester for four classes so far. It was easy to get the hang of the interface and buttons. I teach drafting and drawing, so it has been helpful for demonstrations, reviewing the textbook, and talking over the assignment sheets. I also like the flexibility of being able to plug in directly to our presentation tv screens or to my laptop (which is connected to the screen). I wish it came with a case, though. I ended up buying a PakPod mini tripod case separately and it fits this perfectly. I just don't like the green color of the material.
customer_reviews.author: Julie C.

customer_reviews.title: I’m a teacher- and I love this !!!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I’m so impressed I actually I’m logging on just to review. Ordered last Thursday and received it by Sunday. I’m a teacher so this is for my classroom. I downloaded the software ( super easy) and connected to my projector fast! The quality of the documents I’m projecting is super high! I love this document camera. Eeekkk , Mubarak IT guy came in and was also impressed. He says he might start recommending it to the district since we aren’t buying Elmo’s anymore. If you need to proyect or if you have a classroom- but this! No I’m not getting payed for this, but I spent a lot of time researching a reasonable document camera and this is it!
customer_reviews.author: Elianne Calender

customer_reviews.title: Best Document Camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought 4 of these to use at my school. Started using one this week with my modern language teacher. All his students didn't have their text books - so he was able to project the text book onto the projector screen and everybody was able to participate! Next week - to the chemistry lab! So that 30+ students don't have to huddle around an experiment! Love this thing. Wish we had enough to purchase one for EVERY classroom!
customer_reviews.author: Beckie

customer_reviews.title: Great for someone with macular degeneration
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for someone with macular degeneration. The camera is attached to a Windows 10 computer. This camera is way cheaper than a reading machine which many with macular degeneration are encouraged to purchase. The camera allows her to read mail, pill bottles, food labels, magazines, printed photographs plus anything else she wants to take a look at. She loves it and uses it every day. The camera can be moved manually up or down to be closer or further away from the item to be viewed. You can also zoom in and out with buttons on the camera to get an even closer view. It has been a great help with the visual impairment.
customer_reviews.author: Seven Stars

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the visually impaired
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for a friend who had trouble seeing due to macular degeneration. I had already connected a large screen TV to her computer so she can now see better on her computer but she also want to see what she printed out. This Ipevo document camera is low profile, did not take up much room on her desk and the power can come from her computer with the usb connection so less cords and clutter. I did need to purchase an HDMI cable but you can also hook this up wirelessly with a smart TV , I think. She can now see printed document on her large TV screen. What a great product.
customer_reviews.author: P. louie

customer_reviews.title: Visual Impaired use.
customer_reviews.text: I have a relapsing vision impairment and use this camera to read mail and documents using the Windows 10 camera app, or HDMI straight into my 2nd monitor. It's very well designed. Heavy base, integral light, zoom buttons are concave/convex meaning it's easy to operate by feel. As a $200 solution for visual impairment aid, this camera is a great deal! Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: a must for on line teaching
customer_reviews.text: Needed a document camera to make lessons at home during COVID. Works great. Had an issue because my computer doesn't have the latest updates, so their recording device didn't work for me, but I recorded my screen on quicktime player. Easy work around. Looks like I'll be using it this next year too. :(
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to replace my kid's Visual Aid CCTV.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to try and replace the bulky and expensive CCTV my kid needs to see for reading books and such. The equipment can cost anywhere from $1500 up when all you really need is a camera with soom that plugs straight into a monitor. This has some of the same features as some of the more expensive visual-aid CCTV setups, for less than a tenth of the cost and far less bulky. The camera is easy to use. At first I was a little bit leary because it didn't really come with any instructions. It didn't take me long to realize it was because it didn't need any.
customer_reviews.author: Dymes

customer_reviews.title: micro USB plug
customer_reviews.text: Our school purchased this in August; now it's March. The micro USB plug had become a bit wobbly about two months ago, and the connection was cutting out occasionally. Then a few days ago the female plug came loose and dropped into the inside of the tower. I could use the HDMI plug, but the only way to supply power is through the micro USB. I contacted customer support in CA and am waiting for a reply. I wonder if anyone else has had a similar issue. This seems to be weakness in the design.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Falk

customer_reviews.title: Good for low vision, elderly
customer_reviews.text: I bought the IPEVO VZ-R for my 89 year old mother with low vision. I connected it to her large screen TV through a push-button HDMI switch, so she can go from watching cable TV to using the document camera with a single button push. Since the control buttons have accessibility features, she was quickly able to zoom in and out to be able to view different items. She's now able to read things she'd been having trouble with...activity calendars, phone numbers on her Rolodex cards, word puzzles, etc. She can also see photographs, and objects--the buttons & screen on her flip phone, and what her hearing aid looks like in her ear!
customer_reviews.author: Jan K

customer_reviews.title: Pre-processing causes obvious video/audio out-of-sync issue.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, but the pre-processing within the unit introduces an obvious lag between the audio and the video - up to a 1 second delay - so much so that watching a recorded session is disruptive and off-putting. I'm returning it and buying the cheaper version - it's a straight camera feed to the computer, so the lag issue should not exist. If it does, then I'll have some serious issues with the hype generated around this company and their products. And I'll resort to use my HUE that has served me we to this point, though it lacks in flexibility and camera positioning.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff N.

customer_reviews.title: Best in its Category
customer_reviews.text: Simple design but works well and picture quality is good. I like the fact that you don’t need a computer to use this document reader. I was looking at the Elmo and other brands, but it was way too expensive. I’m glad I got this model.
customer_reviews.author: JY

customer_reviews.title: Compact Document Camera
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get a document camera that was compact and would plug directly into the projector. This fits my needs for my classroom. It is flexible and takes up minimal space.
customer_reviews.author: D BACA

customer_reviews.title: Great for my classroom
customer_reviews.text: I teach math and use this regularly in my classroom. I also used it to flip my classroom where I was able to record lessons and upload them to Youtube.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Zerrer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I love my document camera. I've been using it during distance learning lessons. My students can see clearly and it never fails me. It's easy to use and my third graders can see what I'm showing them. It has helped me during this challenging time teaching from home.
customer_reviews.author: Leticia Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Works Out of the Box
customer_reviews.text: Works out of the box without additional software. Sturdy hardware. I’ve used it for remote instruction as an elementary teacher, paying for it out of pocket. I paid 199.00 in April 2020 and now, October 2020, selling for 499.00!!! Outrageous!!!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Ann S Brooklyn

customer_reviews.title: The fiest one was junk
customer_reviews.text: the first one was evidently one that had been returned, cord would not stay hooked up and continued to fall out. the parts were missing and not all included. after we sent it back we found out what was missing when we reordered and it was a totally different story. It works totally different and better.
customer_reviews.author: Harold E.

customer_reviews.title: Nice document camera.  They are all we buy for our K-12 school
customer_reviews.text: Work in IT for a K-12 school and these are all I buy anymore. Some people are stuck on their 10+ year old ELMO, but I find these to be easier to use and certainly are smaller. Price is right and support is good.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Affordable Doc CAM
customer_reviews.text: This Document Camera worked right out of the box because I had previously downloaded the Visualizer software. Very easy to use, I have used it through my computer and connected it to a second monitor using HDMI. The quality is excellent. I have allowed it with it through Zoom. It has an annotation feature that can be useful. I highly recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Great product with absolutely no instructions
customer_reviews.text: I love this product and it works very nicely. I wish they would point you for some instructions. I only knew that the instructions were on the web site based upon reading more amazon feedback.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Online teaching
customer_reviews.text: This has been excellent. I can show my class exactly what I'm writing on plain white paper. They can save the images or the lecture or I can scan the various pages from the class and email them out later. Easy set-up, excellent resolution and color.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from the VK4 Model
customer_reviews.text: I bought the VK4, it was great but I realized I will use this tool in my teaching more than I realized. Upgraded to this model and have been very happy. larger view capture, better camera quality. Definitely worth the higher cost.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy E.

customer_reviews.title: Good garbage.  Buyer be ware.
customer_reviews.text: While the company show you a picture of a computer with the display on the computer screen, it is not so easy. Apparently, you need to download some sort of software (Visualizer). The thing comes with no instruction manuals and no care. One star is about right.
customer_reviews.author: Prof. Chang Liu

customer_reviews.title: Great document camera! But, after frequent use I am not having issues with the USB port.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in March 2020. As a teacher, this document camera SAVED me during remote and hybrid learning. I used it everyday and was fully satisfied. However, it is now October 2020 and I am having issues with the USB port. The power portion does not appear to be "tight" enough anymore, the USB fits however the connection is loose and the camera will not effectively turn on (I can no longer use it to record videos). I am quite frustrated... it was going so well.
customer_reviews.author: Third grade teacher

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and setup
customer_reviews.text: So simple and so sharp! I have so many comments from my students on how clear my lectures are. The mic works well. Has a neat feature if you download their free program "Visualizer" that allows you to take pictures of multiple pages and turn them into a SINGLE pdf! You just tap the space bar between each page you turn. SO HANDY!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and very well designed!
customer_reviews.text: I use this in most of my online meetings. Solid, dependable and well done tech. Definitely worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: M. Kuffler

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to setup and use. Has a light and auto-focus works really well. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: RC

customer_reviews.title: Will not last long.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera January 2020, and in October 2020 it no longer works. VERY disappointed for the price. The camera now makes a clicking noise when you try and turn it on, but no picture ever shows even after replacing multiple cables and trying several TVs and computers.
customer_reviews.author: Devin Markle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to setup and after about 5 minutes I figured it how to use this in Google Hangouts to share video, lock the focus, and enable my headset microphone. I'm planning on painting miniatures on camera and I am looking forward to using this camera setup.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Awesome document camera
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price!! The set up was easy, it connected directly to my Huddle Space with hdmi... and the picture quality is amazing! This is perfect for my classroom use.
customer_reviews.author: Shaidaee

customer_reviews.title: Works with linux
customer_reviews.text: Great document camera which works perfectly for me with zoom on linux (Fedora). They don't list linux as a supported OS which worried me. The price is good for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Stringer

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: the delivery was quick (a week after I had ordered), and the camera came with a simple manual.
customer_reviews.author: Achiad Sviri

customer_reviews.title: The best support that bI have ever had from any company. Apple like quality.
customer_reviews.text: Support keeps following my progress with learning the ins and outs of the product. Thanks I am a Professor strugging to go on-line instruction in this virus emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Prof Ed

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Working well for my visually impaired student. Not he can access the things he needs for school since we hooked it up to his computer..
customer_reviews.author: Gail Basham

customer_reviews.title: Very uselful for trial.
customer_reviews.text: Used it to publish exhibits during 2 week arbitration hearing. Worked perfectly. Just connect to tv/projector with HDMI connection and you're set
customer_reviews.author: Heriberto Burgos

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality - simple operation
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use - great picture quality, fast auto-focus. Very pleased with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Henninger

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to use in my classroom. It works VERY well.
customer_reviews.author: ESBurgin

customer_reviews.title: Not 1080 and it shows. Its only 720 too bad!
customer_reviews.text: Its not 1080 res and loses too much. This one does 720 x 1280 out its hdmi native, kind of a bunmer.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Miletti

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my online class
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in my online class and it is working very well. In Webex I switch from webcam to this document camera and the class can clearly see what I write. They prefer it to me writing on a tablet or iPad. My old Macbook pro initially had difficulty recognizing it but I emailed the company and they sent me easy instructions that fixed it.
customer_reviews.author: Ardalan V.

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I was impressed with the quality of the image coming out of the TV. Colors are accurate and image is sharp. The design is modern and does not use up a lot of desk real estate. The only thing that is lacking is a power supply which the manufacturer explicitly mentioned but a 5V adapter will definitely complete the package.
customer_reviews.author: Gene

customer_reviews.title: high quality gizmo
customer_reviews.text: very convenient and easy to use. great for handicraft tutorial
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Came with defective cable
customer_reviews.text: The cable that shipped with the document camera was defective, so the document camera would not work at all out of the box. I wasted hours trying to get it to work before trying a cable of my own. Poor quality control!
customer_reviews.author: BG

customer_reviews.title: Does not include a USB power adapter or HDMI cable
customer_reviews.text: Just as the headline reads, this should include a USB power adapter and HDMI cable considering the high cost for what It does. Other than that it works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: WSDPC

customer_reviews.title: Very helpfull ..
customer_reviews.text: Easy use, teaching now is easier than before as i dont need to write on the whiteboard any more, i could show my student figures, secton in books .. etc. The students also liked it as well.
customer_reviews.author: hasan

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It takes a little bit to get it up and running and figuring out how to get the live picture to change as your manipulating something underneath, but once it does it is very durable and excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Sean C. Gum

customer_reviews.title: Very nice document cam
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for making DIY video tutorials for jewelry making. This works very fine, so people can see better what my hands do. If you want to see what I do with this, check my youtube channel Xitin Beads.
customer_reviews.author: Xitin Beads

customer_reviews.title: Great camera.
customer_reviews.text: This is being used by someone with a visual impairment to view written text and objects. This item has definitely helped them improved their ability to see.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Lunderman

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: While the camera did a great job for our teacher, after just one year it stopped working. Quite a disappointment. Any ideas on what could be wrong would be appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Mello

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cam for demos and teaching
customer_reviews.text: I use this to do demos of making reeds when I teach. Wonderful product!
customer_reviews.author: it is ok.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: It worked great! The picture is clear and bright even in a large room. The box needs to fit the camera with the base attached.
customer_reviews.author: Art League of Baytown

customer_reviews.title: Excellent document camera
customer_reviews.text: Excellent for desktop use. Makes an okay webcam. Awesome detail for up close applications. I use for showing electronics and schematics. Beautiful up close detail. Not so much far away.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Don’t leave home without it
customer_reviews.text: Wow! So simple to use and brings written material to life in the classroom.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Carr

customer_reviews.title: Nice features
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up for my classroom, using mostly usb for extra software it features. Like the previous reviews, this software is different and not compatible with previous ipevo products and does not offer split screens like before.
customer_reviews.author: Brn2Shop

customer_reviews.title: Large,sharp images
customer_reviews.text: Liked the magnification. Saves eyes for another five years. Used for reading stock market tables.
customer_reviews.author: John C. M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice item
customer_reviews.text: This little item really works well. Fast, easy set up. Good picture quality
customer_reviews.author: JoAnn H.

product_meta.title: Ipevo VZ-R HDMI/USB Dual Mode 8MP Document Camera — Mac OS, Windows, Chromebook Compatible for Live Demo, Web Conferencing, Remote Teaching, Distance Learning, 8 Megapixel (5-883-4-01-00)
product_meta.description: VZ-R HDMI/USB Dual Mode 8MP Document Camera captures all your material and streams real-time images directly to your TV, projector or monitor with an HDMI input. It also features a USB mode for using with a computer. When in USB mode, VZ-R is compatible with a variety of software, allowing you to use it in different ways. And with its 8MP camera, VZ-R captures at up to 3264 x 2448 (10fps) in USB mode, and up to 1920 x 1080 (30fps) in HDMI mode that delivers crisp and clear images! In addition, with a Sony CMOS image sensor and a powerful Amarelle integrated system-on-a-chip (Sock), you’ll find enhanced performance in areas of focusing speed, noise reduction under low-light conditions and reproduction of colors. Furthermore, VZ-R’s built-in LED light gives you additional illumination for capturing material in dimly lit environments. Enjoy increased durability for VZ-R as its stand has been reinforced with a type of glass fiber reinforced thermoplastic GVX-5H (developed by the Swiss company EMS-GRIVORY) that can withstand heavy daily usage. You’ll also appreciate the lightweight nature of it – VZ-R only weighs 2. 2lbs (1kg) – perfect for swapping between different rooms. VZ-R’s swiveling head, multi-jointed stand, and small footprint allow you to capture freely from different height, angle, and orientation. Last but not least, the buttons conveniently located on VZ-R enable you to adjust the real-time images instantly to better fit your needs. (Please note that VZ-R's package does not include an HDMI cable nor power adapter. )
feature_bullets: Hdmi and USB dual mode. 8 Megapixel camera that captures up to 3264 x 2448 (10Fps) in USB mode, and up to 1920 x 1080 (30Fps) in HDMI mode. Works on Mac, Windows PC and Chromebook.

Performance boost with Sony CMOS Image Sensor and Ambarella integrated system-on-a-chip (SoC) – faster focusing speed, better noise reduction under low-light conditions and excellent reproduction of colors for lesser disruptions, distortion and latency.
Stronger yet lighter with glass fiber reinforced stand (GVX-5H) – increased durability for daily usage yet light-weighted (2. 2 lbs. /1 kg) for swapping between classrooms or conference rooms

Designed and made in Taiwan. Swivelling head, Multi-Jointed stand, and small footprint allow you to capture freely from different height, angle, and orientation. Buttons conveniently located on vz-r's body enable you to adjust real-time images instantly.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars246 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
